Absolutely fantastic, it is filled with whit and the levels are extremely clever and some of them are quite challenging. The characters and story are very well-written. There are community made maps if you're into that and a co-op mode if you have friends to play with. A well-rounded and amazing game. Worth every penny.

===[ Conclusi√≥n ]===
Lo recomiendo bastante. Es una gran secuela que expandi√≥ la historia del primer juego y profundizar en la compa√±√≠a(Aperture Science).

La jugabilidad es en mayor parte igual a la del primer juego( Portales, cubos, botones, c√°maras de prueba), pero agrega nueva mec√°nicas como los geles, las placas de salto de fe o el l√°ser, que remplaza a la bola de energ√≠a, un gran modo Co-operativo Online/Local, etc. Los gr√°ficos son muy buenos y los requisitos si son un poquito exigentes, ya que en algunos momentos te puede dar algunos errores e incluso crasheos, pero nada grave. Tambi√©n hay algunos Mods de la comunidad que expanden tanto la historia y/o jugabilidad como Soundtrack y personajes.

Algunos de los mods disponibles son:
Aperture Tag (Cuesta dinero)
Thinking With a Time Machine (Gratis)
Portal Stories: Mel (Gratis)
y el m√°s reciente: Portal Reloaded (Gratis)

La historia, como ya lo dije, expandi√≥ el universo de Portal/Half-Life con 2 giros de trama, uno esperado y el otro no. Los personajes son muy buenos y con un muy buen humor que te dejan con ganas de saber o interactuar m√°s con ellos, ademas de incluir una historia para el Co-operativo.

El precio es bueno, solo que es mejor que te esperes a los descuentos, ya que lo llegan a poner muy barato (Hasta 22 pesos ac√° en M√©xico), incluso en un Bundle con el primer juego. Aunque la duraci√≥n del juego en general es buena, si ya dominas los juegos Puzzle y eres un Pro en Portal, el juego no va a durar nada para ti

El soundtrack es una delicia, igualaron e incluso dir√≠a que superaron al del primer juego, al igual que la ambientaci√≥n le va de perlas al soundtrack en una Aperture Science de muchos a√±os despu√©s de que GlaDOS fuera desactivada.

Si tienes la oportunidad, compralo, pero es mejor que te esperes a que lo pongan en descuento, tambi√©n si ya te pasaste el mod historia, puedes probar el editor de niveles o "C√°maras de la comunidad" que  es muy buena y no aburre tan f√°cil.
En mi opini√≥n vale mucho la pena, es uno de los mejores juegos de Valve y es una tristeza que no hicieran una tercera parte con el final abierto que dejo el Co-operativo.
Divertid√≠simo! Algunos puzzles son realmente imaginativos. No pens√© que pudiera ser m√°s entretenido que el anterior y encima te cuenta los or√≠genes de Aperture Science! Un 10!

Portal is a must-play if you're into puzzle.And It's more fun if you have friends to share your thinking process!

If you enjoy games then this game will be right up your game!  This game is a game.  Now here's the thing... this game is a BIT of a game.  Now listen, I know that sounds bad, but this game is like the game of games, okay?  On the plus side though, the game has a lot of qualities you could probably call game-like.  Some might disagree with that I suppose, but I think it's very fair to call this a game, especially considering the sheer amount of game in this game.  Honestly, when you think about it, this game is really similar to a game in a lot of ways.  For example, it's a game, and I think that really says it all right there.  Let me explain... this game is like if a game and a game had a baby, and it's remarkably game.  Overall, I have very few problems with the game sections of this game, it's really just the small more game parts of the game that just irked me a little.  I'm sorry you had to hear it from me, but this is a game.  My sincerest apologies to anyone that didn't expect that this game would be such a game but that's just the hard truth.  I recommend this game for its game qualities and I think you should purchase this game.  Watch out for the secret Easter egg in level game.  SPOILER ALERT!!! It's a game.

This right here is another example of how a complete game can be released and be successful with no micro-transactions, add-on content or DLCs. Gameplay is really good, story is amazing, it'll make you chuckle in certain places with good humour and it looks great too considering it's 10 years old now. But it's the puzzles and level design I loved the most, also the community made maps are really worth checking out.

In short it's one of those rare good games out there that ought to be in everyone's library. Other money hungry corporate gaming companies should really take notes from this, because games like Portal 2 is how it's suppose to be done and what gaming was all about in the old days.
Este clasico es hermoso, no me canso de pasarlo y el cooperativo definitivvamente le da un plus, muy divertido la verdad lo amo
